name: Tower Hotel Derry

reviews.text: I love staying at the Tower. it is central, has parking, the facilities are not over pretentious but always excellent and the staff beyond praise from reception, through catering to management. Welcome is effortless, humour and good information abound and nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Always a good craic
Good value for money
reviews.text: Someone said the breakfast was not brilliant and on once occasion there was not the usual spread but for very good reason For another good reason, Paddy's Day yielded fare that eschewed the need of meals for the rest of the day. The buffet is more than adequate and this is from a breakfast addict.
The décor is a little retro but why not. This is a genuine place not a wood and crystal palace, anonymous or fussy. Stay there!!!
reviews.title: Good value and good location

reviews.text: Stayed here mid-week with hubby to save a long drive home one night. Staff were excellent - very helpful and pleasant. Room was fine - clean and spacious. Nothing grand about it but it was functional. I wouldn't have classed the hotel as 4 star, more like 3 star. But for the money it was perfectly acceptable. Breakfast choices were extensive and service again was friendly.
reviews.title: Treasure within the Walls

reviews.text: Clean and nice hotel with helpful and friendly staff. Location is excellent for the centre of town but no real view from the rooms. Decor is a bit dated. Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. Wi-Fi was not free but once subscribed, was fast and reliable.
reviews.title: Average budget hotel

reviews.text: Went twice in March 2013: first for my brother's stag party (twin room), then took my girlfriend for her birthday (suite). Had an excellent stay both times.
reviews.title: Two great stays in a month!

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and spacious with comfy beds and great showers. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurant is first class.
reviews.title: The towerHotel ... the only one inside Derry's walls!

reviews.text: There is also a nice bar on the ground floor and a small sauna on the top floor.
reviews.title: Big Band Bonus

reviews.text: The best bit however is the location; Tower is the only hotel inside Derry's walls. It is right next to the historic wall and the Diamond. Our rooms had great views right down to Free Derry Corner and across the river.
reviews.title: Good location. Lacked ambience. Would not rush back!

reviews.text: I couldn't fault this hotel and would highly recommend it. Prices are very reasonable for a first class stay.
reviews.title: Would return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location for exploring on foot,good bars and restaurant,smallish rooms.Would use again if visiting Londonderry/Derry (stroke city).If you want to walk the famous city wall its 1 minute away and takes a 40 minute "amble" to get round but as the walk passes lots of interesting places could take longer,highly recomended.
reviews.title: ok

reviews.text: we stayed here 2 nites as part of a tour, but would book this place independent of any tour. it is a charming hotel, close to restaurants and shops. beds were comfortable. tho our room was small, we lacked for nothing. the steak and guinness pie in the bar is very good. don't forget to try the irish whiskey on your porridge in the morning - what a wake-me-up!! be sure to walk the walls of the city as well.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in this old hotel located within the walls of the town of Derry. It has parking under the building and was a challenge to enter but free and we did not need a car as everything we wanted to see we could reach on foot. The room was updated, clean and linens were very good quality. The steps to the wall were just outside our hotel so we walked the mile wall and saw the city from a different perspective as well as learned more history in the process. The breakfast buffet was the typical Irish Breakfast fare but had an extra treat....Bushmills and honey for the oatmeal......now that's the way to start the morning!!! The eating area is small and when the tour group was eating it was crowded and noisy but things could have been worse!!!! Also, security was very good, required password to enter car park and room key to go on the elevators.
reviews.title: Wonderful Old Hotel in the Walls of Derry, Updated and Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is located within the old city walls and city center is only a few minutes walk. Room was spacious and very clean. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The breakfast buffet was good. The only negative was the rather high room rate.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Very friendly staff who couldn't do enough for you. Great choice of starters and deserts and three mains to choose from. Our waitress Natalie was very attentive to our baby grandson bringing him potatoes and vegetables the minute we sat down to eat. Johnny the barman was great too. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Delicious sunday carvery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay at this very central hotel which was in walking distance to the city centre and situated along the famous walls. Hotel very clean and food delicious. Breakfast fantastic!!! Staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: great city break

reviews.text: very friendly staff and very helpfull (as are all the locals too ) ,clean modern rooms , good tv with lots of stations ,bar and reception area very pleasant .
reviews.title: friendly staff ,great location

reviews.text: breakfast had everything you could want and again very nice staff .
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: the hotel is in the centre so very easy to get around . you are at the top of the hill so no more up hill walking . the hotel is within the walled city and is next door so you can easily walk round the whole city which is lovely . check out the train journey along the coast .also the museum and the history of the town . i would recommend .
reviews.title: Hen Party Stay!

reviews.text: You won't find a hotel that is more conveniently located in Derry/Londonderry than the Tower Hotel. You can walk everywhere in the City Centre from here. And the staff is amazing - they make you feel very at home.
reviews.title: Awesome

description: Modern building and interior, only hotel within Derry's historic walls - City centre, ideally located and the closest Hotel to both of the Citys Shopping Centres. Has on-site Restaurant, Function room, meeting spaces and Music Themed Bar
